document.body: Home About Parenting Kids Contact Me Bonz World | World of Food and Health where food and health connects Home Let’s Cook Food ♥ Memes Fast Foods&Restos Dine-Ins Take Outs Deliveries Food Promos Health, Body&Fitness PCOS Home&Outdoors Blog Rolls Link Ex TBE 1 TBE 2 BC Bloggers Link Up Food Delivery Bulalo @ Tagaytay Market April 4th, 2012 bonz They said that Bulalo is one of Tagaytay’s specialties, even my hubby confirmed it.  I’ve been there, at Tagaytay, many times already but nobody told me about the Bulalo. Good thing, my best friends suggested to eat Bulalo when they‘kidnapped’me last Monday. The explanation of‘kidnapped’is over my personal/parenting blog, Zoie’s Mom Blogging . I really didn’t know where we ate, I only heard that it was a market in Mahogany.  When you say market and you’re going to eat there, you’ll expect that you’re going to eat at a carinderia or canteen.  But I didn’t expect that it was neatly rowed carinderias.  I think it was, more or less, 10 carinderias lined up.  Mind you, even it is a market place it was clean. Anyway, we picked randomly where we will eat because all of them are serving Bulalo. ^_^  And here’s what we ordered. Bulalo and Crispy Dilis 6 cups of plain rice 4 bowls of Bulalo for me, my best friend Hannah, her husband Jay&close high school buddy, TJ. Of course before eating I need to take some pictures for my food blog. Photo opp! Yum Yum Their Bulalo is so good…^_^ So, as soon as I get back home that day, I told hubby to go back there together and eat Bulalo! Posted in Fast Food&Restaurant Dine-Ins Tags: beef , Bulalo , Bulalo @ Tagaytay Market , Bulalo at Tagaytay , Bulalo soup , food , soup , Tagaytay , Tagaytay Market « More Fillings in my Waffles My Favorite Wake Up Drink » You can leave a response , or trackback from your own site. 5 Responses to“Bulalo @ Tagaytay Market” Batman says: April 5, 2012 at 4:23 am Looks yummy.. Reply Crysstal says: April 10, 2012 at 12:54 am Bulalo looks definitely delicious and it looks really yummy until to the last sip…I hope I can have it by this weekend with the whole family… Crysstal recently posted.. Learning a Foreign Language Can Be Challenging but Rewarding Reply Carmen says: April 11, 2012 at 10:10 am Bulalo! Love it. I’ve try this when we got there in Tagaytay. That is the most delish food I’ve ever tried. Hope I could visit the place again. Carmen recently posted.. Dating Advice For Couples Reply Camise says: April 11, 2012 at 6:41 pm I remember the time when a Filipino friend took me to Tagaytay to have that. It was cheap and very yummy.
